text: Robert Klein (born February 8, 1942) is an American comedian, singer, and actor. He was born in New York City. He was nominated for a Best Actor in a Musical Tony Award for 1979's They're Playing Our Song. He was known for hosting Saturday Night Live twice. Klein starred in many movies such as The Owl and the Pussycat, Hooper, Primary Colors, Radioland Murders, Ira and Abby, One Fine Day, Two Weeks Notice, How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days, The Last Unicorn, and The Safety of Objects. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:American stage actors Category:Actors from New York City Category:Comedians from New York City Category:Singers from New York City
title: Robert Klein
